comment.author: 8095933@N08
comment._content: Hilltop Park at 168th Street and Broadway in upper Manhattan, was the home of the New York American League franchise now known as the Yankees (then called the Highlanders) for its first decade of existence (1903-1912). The Yankees moved across Manhattan to share the Polo Grounds with the NL's Giants (who had briefly used Hilltop Park as a home in 1911 when an earlier version of the Polo Grounds caught on fire). They were the Giants' tenants for another decade until moving across the Harlem River to the Bronx in 1923. Hilltop Park is now the site of Columbia-Presbyterian Medical Center.
